blocks.name: dvferm1

blocks.name: dvferm2
blocks.content: One-sided version of ~ dvferm . A point ` U ` which is the local maximum of its left neighborhood has derivative at least zero. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Feb-2015.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: cmvth
blocks.content: Cauchy's Mean Value Theorem. If ` F , G ` are real continuous functions on ` [ A , B ] ` differentiable on ` ( A , B ) ` , then there is some ` x e. ( A , B ) ` such that ` F ` ' ` ( x ) / G ` ' ` ( x ) = ` ` ( F ( A ) - F ( B ) ) / ( G ( A ) - G ( B ) ) ` . (We express the condition without division, so that we need no nonzero constraints.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: mvth
blocks.content: The Mean Value Theorem. If ` F ` is a real continuous function on ` [ A , B ] ` which is differentiable on ` ( A , B ) ` , then there is some ` x e. ( A , B ) ` such that ` ( RR _D F ) `` x ` is equal to the average slope over ` [ A , B ] ` . This is Metamath 100 proof #75. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Sep-2014.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: c1lip1
blocks.content: C^1 functions are Lipschitz continuous on closed intervals. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 16-Nov-2014.)

blocks.name: c1lip2
blocks.content: C^1 functions are Lipschitz continuous on closed intervals. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 16-Nov-2014.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 6-May-2015.)

thm c1lip2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, co(c0, cicc, c1), wral(s2, co(c0, cicc, c1), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c2, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c2, cv(s1)))), cle, co(cv(s0), cmul, cfv(cabs, co(cv(s2), cmin, cv(s1)))))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfv(cfv(ccpn, cr), nat1)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(crn(c2), cr))

  sylc(w0, wcel(cres(co(cr, cdv, c2), co(c0, cicc, c1)), co(co(c0, cicc, c1), ccncf, cr)), wss(co(c0, cicc, c1), cdm(c2)), wcel(co(cr, cdv, c2), co(cdm(c2), ccncf, cr)))

  dvfre(c2, cdm(c2))

  3syl(w0, wceq(cdm(co(cr, cdv, c2)), cdm(c2)), wcel(co(cr, cdv, c2), co(cdm(c2), ccncf, cc)), wf(co(cr, cdv, c2), cdm(c2), cc))
  cncff(co(cr, cdv, c2), cdm(c2), cc)
  fdm(co(cr, cdv, c2), cdm(c2), cc)
  sylancr(w0, wb(wcel(co(cr, cdv, c2), co(cdm(c2), ccncf, cr)), wf(co(cr, cdv, c2), cdm(c2), cr)), wss(cr, cc), wcel(co(cr, cdv, c2), co(cdm(c2), ccncf, cc)))

  fveq2i(co(cr, cdvn, c2), co(nat0, caddc, nat1), nat1)
  0p1e1()
  syl(w0, wceq(cfv(co(cr, cdvn, c2), co(nat0, caddc, nat1)), co(cr, cdv, cfv(co(cr, cdvn, c2), nat0))), wcel(c2, co(cc, cpm, cr)))
  mp3an13(wcel(c2, co(cc, cpm, cr)), wceq(cfv(co(cr, cdvn, c2), co(nat0, caddc, nat1)), co(cr, cdv, cfv(co(cr, cdvn, c2), nat0))), wss(cr, cc), wcel(nat0, cn0))

  syl(w0, wfun(c2), wcel(c2, co(cc, cpm, cr)))
  pmfun(c2, cc, cr)
  df-f(c2, cdm(c2), cr)

  eqeltrrd(c2, co(cdm(c2), ccncf, cc), cfv(co(cr, cdvn, c2), nat0), w0)
  sylancr(w0, wceq(cfv(co(cr, cdvn, c2), nat0), c2), wss(cr, cc), wcel(c2, co(cc, cpm, cr)))
  syl(w0, wcel(c2, co(cc, cpm, cr)), wcel(c2, cfv(cfv(ccpn, cr), nat1)))
  simplbi(wcel(c2, cfv(cfv(ccpn, cr), nat1)), wcel(c2, co(cc, cpm, cr)), wcel(cfv(co(cr, cdvn, c2), nat1), co(cdm(c2), ccncf, cc)))
  mp2an(wb(wcel(c2, cfv(cfv(ccpn, cr), nat1)), wa(wcel(c2, co(cc, cpm, cr)), wcel(cfv(co(cr, cdvn, c2), nat1), co(cdm(c2), ccncf, cc)))), wss(cr, cc), wcel(nat1, cn0))
  1nn0()
  elcpn(cr, nat1, c2)
  dvn0(cr, c2)
  syl(w0, wcel(cfv(co(cr, cdvn, c2), nat0), co(cdm(c2), ccncf, cc)), wcel(c2, cfv(cfv(ccpn, cr), nat0)))
  sseldi(c2, cfv(cfv(ccpn, cr), nat0), cfv(cfv(ccpn, cr), nat1), w0)
  mp3an(wss(cfv(cfv(ccpn, cr), nat1), cfv(cfv(ccpn, cr), nat0)), wcel(cr, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(nat0, cn0), wcel(nat1, cfv(cuz, nat0)))
  prid1(cr, cc)

  ax-resscn()
  0nn0()

  cncffvrn(cr, c2, cdm(c2), cc)
  rescncf(co(c0, cicc, c1), cdm(c2), c2, cr)
}

thm c1lip2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → ∃(s0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈(c0[[,]]c1), ∀(s2 ∈(c0[[,]]c1),(abs `((c2 ` s2)[-](c2 ` s1)))[≤](s0[×](abs `(s2[-]s1)))))))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈((C^n ` ℝ)` 1))
  ⊣ (w0 → ran(c2)⊆ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0[[,]]c1)⊆ dom(c2))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
  ⊣ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  c1lip1(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  sylc(w0, ((ℝ[_D]c2)|`(c0[[,]]c1))∈((c0[[,]]c1)[-cn->]ℝ), (c0[[,]]c1)⊆ dom(c2), (ℝ[_D]c2)∈(dom(c2)[-cn->]ℝ))
  mpbird(w0, (ℝ[_D]c2)∈(dom(c2)[-cn->]ℝ), ((ℝ[_D]c2): dom(c2)→ ℝ))
  mpbid(w0, ((ℝ[_D]c2): dom(c2)→ ℝ), ((ℝ[_D]c2): dom((ℝ[_D]c2))→ ℝ))
  syl2anc(w0, ((ℝ[_D]c2): dom((ℝ[_D]c2))→ ℝ), (c2 : dom(c2)→ ℝ), dom(c2)⊆ ℝ)
  syl(w0, dom(c2)⊆ ℝ, c2 ∈(ℂ[p↦]ℝ))
  simprbi(c2 ∈(ℂ[p↦]ℝ), dom(c2)⊆ ℝ, (c2 : dom(c2)→ ℂ))
  elpm2(c2, cc, cr)
  cnex()
  dvfre(c2, dom(c2))
  feq2d((ℝ[_D]c2), dom((ℝ[_D]c2)), cr, dom(c2), w0)
  3syl(w0, dom((ℝ[_D]c2))= dom(c2), (ℝ[_D]c2)∈(dom(c2)[-cn->]ℂ), ((ℝ[_D]c2): dom(c2)→ ℂ))
  cncff((ℝ[_D]c2), dom(c2), cc)
  fdm((ℝ[_D]c2), dom(c2), cc)
  sylancr(w0, ((ℝ[_D]c2)∈(dom(c2)[-cn->]ℝ)↔((ℝ[_D]c2): dom(c2)→ ℝ)), ℝ ⊆ ℂ, (ℝ[_D]c2)∈(dom(c2)[-cn->]ℂ))
  eqeltrrd((ℝ[_D]c2), (dom(c2)[-cn->]ℂ), ((ℝ[Dn]c2)` 1), w0)
  eqtrd(((ℝ[Dn]c2)` 1), (ℝ[_D]c2), (ℝ[_D]((ℝ[Dn]c2)` 0)), w0)
  syl5eqr(((ℝ[Dn]c2)` 1), (ℝ[_D]((ℝ[Dn]c2)` 0)), ((ℝ[Dn]c2)`(0[+]1)), w0)
  fveq2i((ℝ[Dn]c2), (0[+]1), nat1)
  0p1e1()
  syl(w0, ((ℝ[Dn]c2)`(0[+]1))=(ℝ[_D]((ℝ[Dn]c2)` 0)), c2 ∈(ℂ[p↦]ℝ))
  mp3an13(c2 ∈(ℂ[p↦]ℝ), ((ℝ[Dn]c2)`(0[+]1))=(ℝ[_D]((ℝ[Dn]c2)` 0)), ℝ ⊆ ℂ, 0 ∈ ℕ0)
  dvnp1(cr, c2, nat0)
  oveq2d(cr, cdv, ((ℝ[Dn]c2)` 0), c2, w0)
  syl(w0, ((ℝ[Dn]c2)` 1)∈(dom(c2)[-cn->]ℂ), c2 ∈((C^n ` ℝ)` 1))
  simprbi(c2 ∈((C^n ` ℝ)` 1), ((ℝ[Dn]c2)` 1)∈(dom(c2)[-cn->]ℂ), c2 ∈(ℂ[p↦]ℝ))
  cncffvrn(cr, (ℝ[_D]c2), dom(c2), cc)
  rescncf((c0[[,]]c1), dom(c2), (ℝ[_D]c2), cr)
  sylc(w0, (c2 |`(c0[[,]]c1))∈((c0[[,]]c1)[-cn->]ℝ), (c0[[,]]c1)⊆ dom(c2), c2 ∈(dom(c2)[-cn->]ℝ))
  mpbird(w0, c2 ∈(dom(c2)[-cn->]ℝ), (c2 : dom(c2)→ ℝ))
  sylanbrc(w0, (c2 : dom(c2)→ ℝ), c2[Fn]dom(c2), ran(c2)⊆ ℝ)
  funfnd(c2, w0)
  syl(w0, Fun(c2), c2 ∈(ℂ[p↦]ℝ))

blocks.name: dv11cn
blocks.content: Two functions defined on a ball whose derivatives are the same and which are equal at any given point ` C ` in the ball must be equal everywhere. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm dv11cn(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, c1))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c3, cfv(cbl, ccom(cabs, cmin)), c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cxr))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c2, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cdm(co(cc, cdv, c0)), c2))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(cc, cdv, c0), co(cc, cdv, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c5), cfv(c1, c5)))
} = {
  mpbid(w0, wceq(c0, c1), wceq(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), cxp(c2, csn(nat0))))
  eqfnfvd(hs0, co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), cxp(c2, csn(nat0)), c2, w0)
  offn(c0, cmin, c1, c2, c2, c2, universe, universe, w0)
  ffnd(c0, c2, cc, w0)
  ffnd(c1, c2, cc, w0)
  mp1i(w0, wfn(cxp(c2, csn(nat0)), c2), wcel(nat0, cc))
  fnconstg(nat0, cc, c2)
  eqtr4d(cfv(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), cv(hs0)), cfv(cxp(c2, csn(nat0)), cv(hs0)), nat0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  abs00d(cfv(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  mpbir2and(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wceq(cfv(cabs, cfv(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), cv(hs0))), nat0), wbr(cfv(cabs, cfv(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), cv(hs0))), cle, nat0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cabs, cfv(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), cv(hs0)))))
  3brtr3d(cfv(cabs, cfv(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), cv(hs0))), cle, nat0, cfv(cabs, co(cfv(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), cv(hs0)), cmin, cfv(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), c5))), co(nat0, cmul, cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c5))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  syldan(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), cv(hs0)), cmin, cfv(co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), c5))), cle, co(nat0, cmul, cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c5)))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(c5, c2)))
  anim1ci(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(c5, c2))
  dvlipcn(hs0, cv(hs0), c2, c5, co(c0, cof(cmin), c1), nat0, c2, c3, c4, w0)

  3syl(w0, wb(wiso(c0, clt, c1, co(c2, cicc, c3), cima(c0, co(c2, cicc, c3))), wiso(c0, clt, c1, co(c2, cicc, c3), crn(c0))), wfn(c0, co(c2, cicc, c3)), wceq(cima(c0, co(c2, cicc, c3)), crn(c0)))

  0red(wa(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cicc, c2)), wcel(cv(hs1), co(c1, cicc, c2)))), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, cv(hs1))))

blocks.content: A function on a closed interval with nonnegative derivative is weakly increasing. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm dvge0(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(cfv(c0, c1), cle, cfv(c0, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(co(c3, cicc, c4), ccncf, cr)))
  -| wi(w0, wf(co(cr, cdv, c0), co(c3, cioo, c4), co(nat0, cico, cpnf)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, co(c3, cicc, c4)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, co(c3, cicc, c4)))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, cle, c2))
} = {
  mpjaod(w0, wbr(cfv(c0, c1), cle, cfv(c0, c2)), wbr(c1, clt, c2), wceq(c1, c2))
  sylibd(w0, wbr(c1, clt, c2), wbr(cfv(c0, c1), cle, cfv(c0, c2)), wbr(nat0, cle, co(cfv(c0, c2), cmin, cfv(c0, c1))))
  ex(w0, wbr(c1, clt, c2), wbr(nat0, cle, co(cfv(c0, c2), cmin, cfv(c0, c1))))
  mpbird(wa(w0, wbr(c1, clt, c2)), wbr(nat0, cle, co(cfv(c0, c2), cmin, cfv(c0, c1))), wbr(nat0, cle, co(co(cfv(c0, c2), cmin, cfv(c0, c1)), cdiv, co(c2, cmin, c1))))
  syl(wa(w0, wbr(c1, clt, c2)), wbr(nat0, cle, co(co(cfv(c0, c2), cmin, cfv(c0, c1)), cdiv, co(c2, cmin, c1))), wcel(co(co(cfv(c0, c2), cmin, cfv(c0, c1)), cdiv, co(c2, cmin, c1)), co(nat0, cico, cpnf)))

thm dvivthlem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, co(cfv(co(cr, cdv, c2), c1), cicc, cfv(co(cr, cdv, c2), c0))))
  -| wceq(c6, cmpt(s1, co(c4, cioo, c5), co(cfv(c2, cv(s1)), cmin, co(c3, cmul, cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

} = {

blocks.name: dvivth
blocks.content: Darboux' theorem, or the intermediate value theorem for derivatives. A differentiable function's derivative satisfies the intermediate value property, even though it may not be continuous (so that ~ ivthicc does not directly apply). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: dvne0
blocks.content: A function on a closed interval with nonzero derivative is either monotone increasing or monotone decreasing. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm dvne0(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wo(wiso(c0, clt, clt, co(c1, cicc, c2), crn(c0)), wiso(c0, clt, ccnv(clt), co(c1, cicc, c2), crn(c0))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(co(c1, cicc, c2), ccncf, cr)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cdm(co(cr, cdv, c0)), co(c1, cioo, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wn(wcel(nat0, crn(co(cr, cdv, c0)))))

blocks.name: dvne0f1

blocks.name: lhop1
blocks.content: L'Hôpital's Rule for limits from the right. If ` F ` and ` G ` are differentiable real functions on ` ( A , B ) ` , and ` F ` and ` G ` both approach 0 at ` A ` , and ` G ( x ) ` and ` G ` ' ` ( x ) ` are not zero on ` ( A , B ) ` , and the limit of ` F ` ' ` ( x ) / G ` ' ` ( x ) ` at ` A ` is ` C ` , then the limit ` F ( x ) / G ( x ) ` at ` A ` also exists and equals ` C ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: lhop2
blocks.content: L'Hôpital's Rule for limits from the left. If ` F ` and ` G ` are differentiable real functions on ` ( A , B ) ` , and ` F ` and ` G ` both approach 0 at ` B ` , and ` G ( x ) ` and ` G ` ' ` ( x ) ` are not zero on ` ( A , B ) ` , and the limit of ` F ` ' ` ( x ) / G ` ' ` ( x ) ` at ` B ` is ` C ` , then the limit ` F ( x ) / G ( x ) ` at ` B ` also exists and equals ` C ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: lhop
blocks.content: L'Hôpital's Rule. If ` I ` is an open set of the reals, ` F ` and ` G ` are real functions on ` A ` containing all of ` I ` except possibly ` B ` , which are differentiable everywhere on ` I \ { B } ` , ` F ` and ` G ` both approach 0, and the limit of ` F ` ' ` ( x ) / G ` ' ` ( x ) ` at ` B ` is ` C ` , then the limit ` F ( x ) / G ( x ) ` at ` B ` also exists and equals ` C ` . This is Metamath 100 proof #64. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: dvcnvre
blocks.content: The derivative rule for inverse functions. If ` F ` is a continuous and differentiable bijective function from ` X ` to ` Y ` which never has derivative ` 0 ` , then ` ``' F ` is also differentiable, and its derivative is the reciprocal of the derivative of ` F ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: dvfsumle
blocks.content: Compare a finite sum to an integral (the integral here is given as a function with a known derivative). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: dvfsumge
blocks.content: Compare a finite sum to an integral (the integral here is given as a function with a known derivative). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-May-2016.)

thm dvfsumge(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {

blocks.name: dvfsumabs
blocks.content: Compare a finite sum to an integral (the integral here is given as a function with a known derivative). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-May-2016.)

thm dvfsumabs(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(cfv(cabs, co(csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c2), cmin, co(c3, cmin, c4))), cle, csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s1, co(c0, cicc, c1), c6), co(co(c0, cicc, c1), ccncf, cc)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), co(c0, cioo, c1))), wcel(c7, c8))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(cr, cdv, cmpt(s1, co(c0, cioo, c1), c6)), cmpt(s1, co(c0, cioo, c1), c7)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), c0), wceq(c6, c4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), c1), wceq(c6, c3))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cfzo, c1))), wcel(c2, cc))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cfzo, c1))), wcel(c5, cr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)), wcel(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cioo, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c2, cmin, c7)), cle, c5))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c8)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  eqbrtrrd(cfv(cabs, co(csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c2), cmin, co(c3, cmin, c4))), cle, csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c5), cfv(cabs, csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(c2, cmin, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6))))), w0)
  fveq2d(cabs, csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(c2, cmin, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6)))), co(csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c2), cmin, co(c3, cmin, c4)), w0)
  eqtrd(csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(c2, cmin, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6)))), co(csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c2), cmin, co(c3, cmin, c4)), co(csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c2), cmin, csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6)))), w0)
  fsumsub(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c2, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6)), w0)
  oveq2d(csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c2), cmin, csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6))), co(c3, cmin, c4), w0)
  telfsumo2(s0, hs0, c0, c1, csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), csb(s1, cv(s0), c6), c3, c4, csb(s1, cv(hs0), c6), w0)
  csbied(s1, cv(hs0), c6, c4, universe, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  a1i(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), universe))
  syl(wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))), wceq(c6, c4), wceq(cv(s1), c0))
  biimpa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s1), c0))
  eqeq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s1))

  a1i(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), universe))
  vex(hs0)
  syl(wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))), wceq(c6, c3), wceq(cv(s1), c1))
  biimpa(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s1), c1))
  eqeq2(cv(hs0), c1, cv(s1))
  letrd(cfv(cabs, csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(c2, cmin, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6))))), csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c5), csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), cfv(cabs, co(c2, cmin, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6))))), w0)
  abscld(csu(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(c2, cmin, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6)))), w0)
  fsumcl(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(c2, cmin, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6))), w0)
  fsumrecl(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), cfv(cabs, co(c2, cmin, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6)))), w0)
  fsumrecl(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), c5, w0)
  fsumabs(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(c2, cmin, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6))), w0)
  fsumle(s0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), cfv(cabs, co(c2, cmin, co(csb(s1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1), c6), cmin, csb(s1, cv(s0), c6)))), c5, w0)

  dvfre(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), c0)

blocks.pretty:
thm dvmptrecl(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c1 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ⊆ ℝ)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c2 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c1 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 →(ℝ[_D](s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2))=(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  fvmptelrn(s0, c0, c1, cr, w0)
  mpbid(w0, ((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1): c0 → ℝ), ((ℝ[_D](s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)): dom((ℝ[_D](s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)))→ ℝ))
  syl2anc(w0, ((ℝ[_D](s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)): dom((ℝ[_D](s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)))→ ℝ), ((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2): c0 → ℝ), c0 ⊆ ℝ)
  fmpttd(s0, c0, c2, cr, w0)
  dvfre((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2), c0)
  feq12d((ℝ[_D](s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)), dom((ℝ[_D](s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2))), cr, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1), c0, w0)
  eqtrd(dom((ℝ[_D](s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2))), c0, dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)), w0)
  dmeqd((ℝ[_D](s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)), (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1), w0)
  syl(w0, dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))= c0, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1 ∈ c3))
  ralrimiva(s0, c0, w0, c1 ∈ c3)
  dmmptg(s0, c0, c1, c3)
  diff.cr.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: dvfsumrlim
blocks.content: Compare a finite sum to an integral (the integral here is given as a function with a known derivative). The statement here says that if ` x e. S |-> B ` is a decreasing function with antiderivative ` A ` converging to zero, then the difference between ` sum_ k e. ( M ... ( |_ `` x ) ) B ( k ) ` and ` A ( x ) = S. u e. ( M [,] x ) B ( u ) _d u ` converges to a constant limit value, with the remainder term bounded by ` B ( x ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: dvfsumrlim2
blocks.content: Compare a finite sum to an integral (the integral here is given as a function with a known derivative). The statement here says that if ` x e. S |-> B ` is a decreasing function with antiderivative ` A ` converging to zero, then the difference between ` sum_ k e. ( M ... ( |_ `` x ) ) B ( k ) ` and ` S. u e. ( M [,] x ) B ( u ) _d u = A ( x ) ` converges to a constant limit value, with the remainder term bounded by ` B ( x ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-May-2016.)

blocks.name: dvfsum2
blocks.content: The reverse of ~ dvfsumrlim , when comparing a finite sum of _increasing_ terms to an integral. In this case there is no point in stating the limit properties, because the terms of the sum aren't approaching zero, but there is nevertheless still a natural asymptotic statement that can be made. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-May-2016.)

blocks.name: ftc1
blocks.content: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, part one. The function formed by varying the right endpoint of an integral is differentiable at ` C ` with derivative ` F ( C ) ` if the original function is continuous at ` C ` . This is part of Metamath 100 proof #15. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:

  mpbir2and(w0, wbr(c0, co(cr, cdv, c1), cfv(c2, c0)), wcel(c0, cfv(cfv(cnt, c8), co(c3, cicc, c4))), wcel(cfv(c2, c0), co(cmpt(hs0, cdif(co(c3, cicc, c4), csn(c0)), co(co(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cmin, cfv(c1, c0)), cdiv, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c0))), climc, c0)))

  a1i(w0, wcel(c8, ctop))
  eqeltri(c8, ctop, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  retop()

blocks.name: ftc1cn
blocks.content: Strengthen the assumptions of ~ ftc1 to when the function ` F ` is continuous on the entire interval ` ( A , B ) ` ; in this case we can calculate ` _D G ` exactly. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: ftc2
blocks.content: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, part two. If ` F ` is a function continuous on ` [ A , B ] ` and continuously differentiable on ` ( A , B ) ` , then the integral of the derivative of ` F ` is equal to ` F ( B ) - F ( A ) ` . This is part of Metamath 100 proof #15. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: itgparts
blocks.content: Integration by parts. If ` B ( x ) ` is the derivative of ` A ( x ) ` and ` D ( x ) ` is the derivative of ` C ( x ) ` , and ` E = ( A x. B ) ( X ) ` and ` F = ( A x. B ) ( Y ) ` , then under suitable integrability and differentiability assumptions, the integral of ` A x. D ` from ` X ` to ` Y ` is equal to ` F - E ` minus the integral of ` B x. C ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: itgsubst
blocks.content: Integration by ` u ` -substitution. If ` A ( x ) ` is a continuous, differentiable function from ` [ X , Y ] ` to ` ( Z , W ) ` , whose derivative is continuous and integrable, and ` C ( u ) ` is a continuous function on ` ( Z , W ) ` , then the integral of ` C ( u ) ` from ` K = A ( X ) ` to ` L = A ( Y ) ` is equal to the integral of ` C ( A ( x ) ) _D A ( x ) ` from ` X ` to ` Y ` . In this part of the proof we discharge the assumptions in ~ itgsubstlem , which use the fact that ` ( Z , W ) ` is open to shrink the interval a little to ` ( M , N ) ` where ` Z < M < N < W ` - this is possible because ` A ( x ) ` is a continuous function on a closed interval, so its range is in fact a closed interval, and we have some wiggle room on the edges. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Sep-2014.)
